result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen Thomas Gay Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying Concealed Weapon. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glen Thomas Gay Jr

records.addlTxt:
Order on Stipulation, signed and filed.
The parties having negotiated a fair and appropriate resolution of this case, the State and Defense now stipulate to the following:
1. That the criminal charge in this case, Carrying a Concealed Weapon, be amended to the Milwaukee County ordinance violation of Carrying a Concealed Weapon under 63.015.
2. Counsel for defendant has explained this negotiated resolution and obtained authorization from defendant to enter his plea and resolve this case on defendants behalf.
3. Defendant agrees to and accepts this amendment, and pleads No Contest to that offense
4. Defendant agrees to forfeit the firearm and not petition for its return.
5. Defendant agrees to pay a forfeiture of $ 500, inclusive of all costs, due in 6 months.
6. That any future scheduled court dates be vacated.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED BY THE COURT that the Stipulation signed by the parties is approved and the no contest plea is accepted. The Court finds defendant guilty of the amended forfeiture offense and orders a $500 forfeiture, inclusive of all costs, due in 6 months
Any unpaid balance by the due date will convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant Glen Thomas Gay in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Defense counsel requests additional plea and sentencing hearing, in person.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Glen Thomas Gay in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Parties request an adjourned plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Glen Thomas Gay in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Glen Thomas Gay appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Glen Thomas Gay in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/3/22 @ 2:30p
